intro: Senecio vagus subsp. eglandulosus, commonly known as the glandless groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive shape, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. It is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects.
